bio:treatment.description: Herbs annual [perennial], 0.3–2(–3)[–8] dm. Leaves mostly opposite, <basal soon withering, sometimes in rosettes, distal cauline sometimes alternate>, stipulate or estipulate, petiolate or sessile; blade usually 3[–5]-veined from base, margins sometimes revolute, <surfaces hairy [glabrous], hairs sometimes clustered (stellate)>. Inflorescences racemiform [helicoid, scorpioid] cymes. Pedicels present; bracts [present or] absent. Flowers chasmogamous and cleistogamous, <nodding or pendulous in bud>. bio:treatment.discussion: Species 8–12 (1 in the flora): introduced, California; c, w Europe, n Africa.
Tuberaria differs from Crocanthemum and Helianthemum primarily in habit, mostly opposite leaves, and sessile or subsessile stigmas.
